files.patch: @@ -119,2 +119,2 @@ - * Double#equals equals} uses representation - * equivalence, defining NaN arguments to be equal to each other, + * Double#equals equals} uses {@linkplain ##repEquivalence representation + * equivalence}, defining NaN arguments to be equal to each other, @@ -594,0 +594,9 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the general functionality of + * convertToDecimalCharacter operation defined in IEEE 754; + * however, that operation is defined in terms of specifying the + * number of significand digits used in the conversion, a + * configuration parameter offered by the precision flag of + * several numeric floating-point conversions of {@link + * java.util.Formatter}. + * @@ -674,0 +683,5 @@ + * + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToHexCharacter operation + * defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -900,0 +914,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertFromDecimalCharacter and + * convertFromHexCharacter operations defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -1090,0 +1108,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1103,0 +1122,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1112,0 +1132,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToIntegerTowardZero + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -1115,0 +1139,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1123,0 +1148,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToIntegerTowardZero + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -1127,0 +1156,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1144,0 +1174,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1153,0 +1184,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1213,3 +1245,2 @@ - * relation must be implemented; see this discussion for details of - * floating-point equality and equivalence. + * relation must be implemented; see {@linkplain ##equivalenceRelation + * this discussion for details of floating-point equality and equivalence}. @@ -1392,3 +1423,3 @@ - * equals; see this - * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and - * ordering. + * equals; see {@linkplain ##equivalenceRelation this + * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and + * ordering}. @@ -1408,0 +1439,1 @@ + @Override

@@ -310,0 +310,9 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the general functionality of + * convertToDecimalCharacter operation defined in IEEE 754; + * however, that operation is defined in terms of specifying the + * number of significand digits used in the conversion, a + * configuration parameter offered by the precision flag of + * several numeric floating-point conversions of {@link + * java.util.Formatter}. + * @@ -390,0 +399,5 @@ + * + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToHexCharacter operation + * defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -527,0 +541,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertFromDecimalCharacter and + * convertFromHexCharacter operations defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -732,0 +750,1 @@ + @Override @@ -745,0 +764,1 @@ + @Override @@ -753,0 +773,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToIntegerTowardZero + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -757,0 +781,1 @@ + @Override @@ -765,0 +790,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToIntegerTowardZero + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -769,0 +798,1 @@ + @Override @@ -778,0 +808,1 @@ + @Override @@ -795,0 +826,1 @@ + @Override @@ -842,3 +874,2 @@ - * relation must be implemented; see this discussion for - * details of floating-point equality and equivalence. + * relation must be implemented; see {@linkplain Double##equivalenceRelation + * this discussion for details of floating-point equality and equivalence}. @@ -1095,1 +1126,1 @@ - * The binary16 format is discussed in + * The {@linkplain ##binary16Format binary16 format} is discussed in @@ -1211,3 +1242,3 @@ - * equals; see this - * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and - * ordering. + * equals; see {@linkplain Double##equivalenceRelation this + * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and + * ordering}. @@ -1228,0 +1259,1 @@ + @Override
